text: The Bangladesh Cyclone of 1991 was an extremely devastating super cyclonic storm. On the evening of Monday, April 29, 1991 a strong super cyclonic storm struck the Chittagong area of southeastern Bangladesh with winds around 155 mph. The storm killed over 138,000 people and caused $1.5 billion in destruction. The cyclone left almost ten million homeless. Category:Deadly storms Category:20th century in Bangladesh Category:Cyclonic storms Category:1991 in Asia Category:1990s in weather
title: 1991 Bangladesh cyclone
